abstract: Enable receiving notifications without displaying the notification to the user.
overview:
## Discussion

This entitlement allows a notification service extension to receive remote notifications without displaying the notification to the user. To apply for this entitlement, see [https://developer.apple.com/contact/request/notification-service].

After you receive permission to use the entitlement, add [doc://com.apple.bundleresources/documentation/BundleResources/Entitlements/com.apple.developer.usernotifications.filtering] to the entitlements file in the Notification Service Extension target. This allows you to silence push notifications after your extension receives them.

### Silence Push Notifications

To suppress a notification’s alert, create an empty [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/UserNotifications/UNNotificationContent] object in your extension’s [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/UserNotifications/UNNotificationServiceExtension/didReceive(_:withContentHandler:)] method, and pass it to the content handler. Don’t specify a title, subtitle, body, attachments, or sound for the content.

items.description: The environment for push notifications in macOS apps.
items.name: APS Environment (macOS) Entitlement

items.description: An entitlement that permits an app to receive critical alert notifications.
items.name: Critical Alerts

title: com.apple.developer.usernotifications.filtering
